All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary Exception Summary Annotation Types Summary 
    Class Description
    ActivePlayerMessage
    A message to the client containing the object of the active player during the current turn
    ActivityNotAllowedException
    This class defines a particular Exception, called when the Player calls a method when it is not supposed to be its turn
    AdditionalMoveState
    This class represents the moment where the Player has a either an optional additional move, or a move state that is forced to be bound to a specific builder
    AllowedSquaresMessage
    A message containing the list of Square objects where a Builder can perform his actions
    AnyDomeBuild
    It's a Build Behavior decorator that adds the possibility to choose between a normal build and a dome
    Apollo
    A God that has a SwapWithOpponentMove behavior
    App
    Main class for the Santorini application Parses command arguments and launches the Application with the desired settings
    Artemis
    A God that has a DoubleNoBackMove behavior
    AssetLoader
    This class contains all the method required to handle the text Information about the Gods in the configuration file
    Athena
    A God that has a BlockUpMove behavior
    Atlas
    A God that has a AnyDomeBuild behavior
    AvailableGodsMessage
    A message to the client containing the Available Gods Message
    BeneathBuild
    It's a Build Behavior decorator that adds to the neighborhood the square the builder is currently positioned on
    BlockUpMove
    It's a Move Behavior decorator that adds the following effect: if the builder move up, opponent builders would not be able to move up on their next turn (their move behaviors would be decorated with NoUpMove
    Board
    a 5x5 board where most of the Game takes place
    BoardMessage
    A message to the client containing a Board object
    BoardScreen
    Logic view of the Board.
    BoardScreenBuilder
    Builder for the BoardScreen
    BuildBehavior
    Contains the strategies for finding the buildable squares and for moving the builder.
    BuildDecorator
    It's the abstract Build Behavior decorator (all the concrete build decorator must extend this class)
    Builder
    a pawn of a Player
    BuilderPositionMessage
    A Message to the client containing a list of all builders in the board
    BuildState
    This class represents the building Phase.
    Chronus
    A God that has a FiveTowerWinCondition behavior
    CLIBoardScreen
    This class represents the Screen that is shown during form the moment the game starts to the moment of its end
    CLIConnectionErrorScreen
    This class represents the screen that is shown when a connection error eccurs
    CLIConnectionScreen
    This class represents the screen that is shown when the player chooses to start the game
    Client
    Static class for the Client-side application.
    ClientErrorMessages
    This class contains a set of messages that are used to signal specific errors during the game
    ClientHandler
    Handler for communications from/to each client.
    CLIGodSelectionScreen
    This class represents the screen that is shown when the game is at the GodSelection Phase It prints the list of gods and allows the player to either choose which god to select or just read at their description
    CLIMenuScreen
    The screen that shows up at the start of the application
    CLIPickGodScreen
    This class represents the screen that is shown when the game is at the GodPicking phase Here the players can, one by one, pick the gods from a pool previously selected
    CLIScreenFactory
    This is the ScreenFactory of the CLI.
    CLIWinnerScreen
    This class represents the screen that is shown when a player wins the game It is responsible for writing the Winning Message and it allows the player to choose what to oo next
    Colors
    This class contains the list of all colors used in the game all the colors are 8-bit colors, and each of them is represented using the corresponding escape code
    ConnectionErrorScreen
    In this screen is displayed a connection error message
    ConnectionScreen
    This screen asks to the user to insert an IP, a port, a nickname and the number of players.
    Controller
    This is the general Controller of the entire application.
    Coordinate
    This class is the representation of a standard two-dimensional coordinate.
    CreditsScreen
    This screen should display the credits of the game From this screen it's possible to: - Go back to the MenuScreen
    Demeter
    A God that has a DoubleNotSameBuild behavior
    DisconnectClientMessage
    A message to the client sent from the server before disconnecting
    DisconnectServerMessage
    A message sent to the Server when the client wants to disconnect
    DoubleNoBackMove
    It's a Move Behavior decorator that adds the possibility to move twice (the second move can't be to the initial square)
    DoubleNoPerimeterBuild
    It's a Build Behavior decorator that adds the possibility to build twice (the second build can't be on the board perimeter)
    DoubleNotSameBuild
    It's a Build Behavior decorator that adds the possibility to build twice (the second build can't be on the same square)
    DoubleSameBuild
    It's a Build Behavior decorator that adds the possibility to build twice (the second build must be on the same square)
    DrawElements
    This class contains all the methods responsible for the aesthetic of the game and its appearance
    DuplicateNameException
    This class represents the Exception thrown when the instance of an object with a name is already present where it should not be
    EndGameState
    This state represents the End of the game.
    EndPhaseMessage
    A message sent when the player wants to end his phase without doing any additional move/build
    EndTurnState
    This class represents the moment where a Turn has ended
    ErrorMessage
    contains specific error messages that can be thrown
    ExceptionMessage
    A message sent to the client when an illegal call to controller is made
    FirstActionMessage
    A message to the Server containing the first action of the turn made from the player
    FiveTowerWinCondition
    It's a Win Condition decorator that allows to win when there are five complete towers (3 build level + dome) on the board
    Game
    A match at the game "Santorini" between two or three Player
    Game.State
    an identifier for the game phase
    GameController
    This class represent the Controller of the Game.
    GameModel
    This is the interfaces that defines the game as the target for the methods of the Game State Machine
    GameObserver
    This interface defines the methods implemented from all views to states change in the Game model
    GameState
    Interface for the States of the GameState machine
    GameStateMessage
    A message to the client containing the actual GameState and the active player
    God
    A generic God class.
    GodAssetsBundle
    This class contains the methods used to handle the files of the gods
    GodFactory
    A factory for God (factory pattern)
    GodPickState
    This state represents the moment where the player can choose which god to use from the list of god previously created
    GodSelectionScreen
    This screen should display all the choosable gods of the game The first player can select two or three gods (according to the number of players) then he can submit the choices and move the game to the PickGodScreen
    GodSelectionScreenBuilder
    Screen Builder for the GodSelectionScreen
    GodSelectionState
    This State represents the moment where the player can selects the list of gods he wants to be available in the game
    GUI
    manages the GUI start and the change of the current GUI screen
    GUIBoard
    This class represents the GUI controller during the real game (after the pick god phase)
    GUIConnection
    This class represents the GUI controller during the connection phase
    GUIConnectionError
    This class represents the GUI controller during a connection error
    GUIController
    the interface implemented in every GUI Controller of the game
    GUICredits
    This class represents the GUI controller in the Credits screen
    GUIGodSelection
    This class represents the GUI controller during the god selection phase
    GUIMenu
    This class represents the GUI controller of the menu
    GUIPickGod
    This class represents the GUI controller during the pick god phase
    GUIScreenFactory
    A factory for GUIScreen (factory pattern)
    GUIWinner
    This class represents the GUI controller at the end of a game
    Hephaestus
    A God that has a DoubleSameBuild behavior
    Hera
    A God that impose a NoPerimeterWinCondition behavior to other gods
    Hestia
    A God that has a DoubleNoPerimeterBuild behavior
    IllegalActionException
    This class defines a particular exception, called when the action cannot be executed (usually because the parameters are invalid)
    IllegalValueException
    IllegalValueException is a checked exception thrown when an user input is not valid
    InputExecutor
    This is the interface that defines every class that represent a different phase of the game
    InputListener
    This class represent the thread that listens to stdin and delivers the input to the current screen
    InputProcessor
    This interface accomunates every screen that interacts with an InputListener
    Lobby
    The matchmaking system for the server Singleton pattern is used to ensure that only two instance of this class are created (one for 2 players matches and one for 3 players matches) When a Client Handler listener thread reaches out this class, it will wait enough players to start a match.
    LoginDataMessage
    The first message sent to the server containing the username and the number of players of the game
    MatchFoundMessage
    A message to the client sent when a match is found.
    MenuScreen
    This screen should display the menu of the game From this screen it's possible to:
    Message<Target extends MessageTarget>
    A common interface to define what is message.
    MessageTarget
    A marker interface for all objects that could be reached from a Message sent through the network
    Minotaur
    A God that has a OpponentPushMove behavior
    Mortal
    The default God that has standard behaviors
    MoveBehavior
    Contains the strategies for finding the reachable squares and for moving the builder.
    MoveDecorator
    It's the abstract Move Behavior decorator (all the concrete move decorator must extend this class)
    MoveState
    This class represents the first action of the Turn.
    NoPerimeterWinCondition
    It's a Win Condition decorator that not allows to win with a builder on a perimeter square
    NoUpMove
    It's a Move Behavior decorator that limits the neighborhood, impeding to move up
    Observable<Observer extends Observer>
    This interface is a custom implementation of the Observer pattern It is a parametric implementation
    Observer
    Marker interface for observers
    OpponentPushMove
    It's a Move Behavior decorator that adds the possibility to move into an opponent builder square (if the opponent builder can be forced one square straight backwards to an unoccupied square at any level)
    Outcome
    Represents all possible statuses of a player
    Pan
    A God that has a TwoDownWinCondition behavior
    PickGodMessage
    A message to the server containing the name of the god picked from the player
    PickGodScreen
    In this screen all god chosen in the GodSelectionPhase should be displayed.
    PickGodScreenBuilder
    Screen Builder for the PickGodScreen
    PingToClient
    A ping message to check if the client connection is still alive
    PingToServer
    A ping from the client to the server used to check if the connection to the server is alive
    PlaceBuilderMessage
    A message containing the coordinate of the square in where the builder is placed
    PlaceBuilderState
    This class represents the moment where the players can place their builders on the board
    Player
    participant in a Game
    PlayerListMessage
    A message to the client containing the list of Player objects.
    Prometheus
    A God that can build before the move phase (in that case he will have a NoUpMove behavior for the rest of the turn)
    ProtocolViolationException
    This class defines a particular exception, called when there is something wrong with the flow of the State Machine
    RemoteView
    This class represents the abstraction of the Client, observed from the point of view of the Server It is the communication Link between the Client and the Server
    Screen
    A generic screen of the view (every screen of the view must extend this class) The screen is a View and gets messages from the server through the server listeners
    ScreenBuilder
    A screen builder saves the initial parameters for the next screen, and then when the buildScreen() method is called builds and returns the next screen object, using the provided ScreenFactory
    ScreenFactory
    Factory Interface for building concrete Screen (factory pattern)
    SelectCoordinateMessage
    A message sent to server when a square is selected to do an action
    Server
    A Static class for initializing and launching the Server side of the Application
    ServerAdapter
    Client Side Handler for network messages to and from the server
    ServerListener
    This Tag defines whatever is considered a listener
    Square
    A single square in the game Board
    StandardBuild
    It's the Build Behavior main component that allows a standard build
    StandardMove
    It's a Movec Behavior main component that allows a standard move
    StandardWinCondition
    It's a Win Condition main component that allows a standard win condition (if one of your builder move up, reaching a building at level 3)
    StateErrorMessage<T extends StateIdentifier>
    A message sent to the client when a controller call is legit, but made in the wrong model state
    StateIdentifier
    The interface implemented by every enum that lists a set of names for the FSM States
    StateMachineController
    This is the abstract class that contains the Common methods of both the TurnController and the GameController
    SubmitGodListMessage
    Message sent to the server containing the god to use for the game
    SwapWithOpponentMove
    It's a Move Behavior decorator that adds the possibility to move into an opponent builder’s square by forcing their builder to the space yours just vacated.
    Triton
    A God that has a UnlimitedPerimetralMove behavior
    Turn
    This class represents a Turn of the game.
    Turn.State
    The list of names of the different States in the Turn State Machine
    TurnController
    This class represents the Controller of the Turn.
    TurnObserver
    The interface implemented by each class that is observer of the Turn State
    TurnState
    This class represents the Turn State.
    TurnState
    Interface for the states of the Turn State Machine
    TurnStateMessage
    A message to the client containing the actual TurnState and the active player
    TwoDownWinCondition
    It's a Win Condition decorator that allows to win going down of two or more level in a single move
    UnlimitedPerimetralMove
    It's a Move Behavior decorator that, each time your builder moves into a perimeter square, adds the possibility to immediately move again
    UpdateDoneMessage
    The last message sent at every group of message sent from the server
    View
    A view is any views that observe the game and send commands to the controller.
    ViewManager
    Handles the view screens, and calls server adapters methods in order to communicate with the server
    WinCondition
    Contains the strategies for finding the winning conditions.
    WinConditionDecorator
    It's the abstract Win Condition decorator (all the concrete win conditions must extend this class)
    WinnerScreen
    Screen where the results of the finished game are shown
    WinnerScreenBuilder
    Builds the WinnerScreen
    Zeus
    A God that has a BeneathBuild behavior
